edu.ucla.sspace.vector
Class Vectors

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.vector.Vectors

public class Vectors
extends Object

A collection of static methods that operate on or return Vector instances, following a format similar to that of Collections.

Unless otherwise noted, all returned Vector instances implement Serializable.

Author:
Keith Stevens, David Jurgens

Method Detail

asDouble

public static DoubleVector asDouble(Vector v)
Returns a view over the given Vector as a DoubleVector. The returned vector is mutable but any changes will be converted into its internal data-type, e.g. int, which may result in information loss.

Parameters:
v - The Vector to return as a DoubleVector.
Returns:
a mutable DoubleVector view of v

asDouble

public static SparseDoubleVector asDouble(SparseIntegerVector v)

asVector

public static DoubleVector asVector(double[] array)
Returns a vector backed by the specified array. Any changes to the vector are written through to the array. This method acts a bridge between array-based and Vector-based computation.

Parameters:
array - the array backing the vector
Returns:
a Vector view of the array

asVector

public static IntegerVector asVector(int[] array)
Returns a vector backed by the specified array. Any changes to the vector are written through to the array. This method acts a bridge between array-based and Vector-based computation.

Parameters:
array - the array backing the vector
Returns:
a Vector view of the array

equals

public static boolean equals(DoubleVector v1,
                             DoubleVector v2)
Returns true if the two vectors are equal to one another. Two Vector insances are considered equal if they contain the same number of elements and all corresponding pairs of double values are equal.

equals

public static boolean equals(IntegerVector v1,
                             IntegerVector v2)
Returns true if the two integer vectors are equal to one another. Two Vector insances are considered equal if they contain the same number of elements and all corresponding pairs of int values are equal.

equals

public static boolean equals(Vector v1,
                             Vector v2)
Returns true if the two vectors are equal to one another. Two Vector insances are considered equal if they contain the same number of elements and all corresponding pairs of Number values are equal. Two values n1 and n2 are considered equal if n1.equals(n2).

Parameters:
vector - The DoubleVector to decorate as immutable.
Returns:
An immutable version of vector.

atomic

public static DoubleVector atomic(DoubleVector vector)
Returns a thread-safe version of a DoubleVector that guarantees atomic access to all operations. The returned vector allows concurrent read access.

Parameters:
vector - The DoubleVector to decorate as atomic.
Returns:
An atomic version of vector.

synchronizedVector

public static DoubleVector synchronizedVector(DoubleVector vector)
Returns a syncrhonized view of a given DoubleVector. This may show slightly better performance than using an AtomicVector in some use cases.

Parameters:
vector - The DoubleVector to decorate as synchronized.
Returns:
An atomic version of vector.

subview

public static DoubleVector subview(DoubleVector vector,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length)
Returns a subview for the given DoubleVector with a specified offset and length.

Parameters:
vector - the Vector whose values will be shown in the view
offset - the index of v at which the first index of this view starts
length - the length of this view.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if
  • offset is negative
  • length is less than zero
  • the sum of offset plus length is greater than the length of vector

subview

length - the length of this view.
Throws:

  • offset is negative
  • length is less than zero

copy

public static Vector copy(Vector dest,
                          Vector source)
Copies all of the values from one Vector into another. After the operation, all of the values in dest will be the same as that of source. The legnth of dest must be as long as the length of source. Once completed dest is returned.

Parameters:
dest - The Vector to copy values into.
source - The Vector to copy values from.
Returns:
dest after being copied from source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the length of dest is less than that of source.

copyOf

public static DoubleVector copyOf(DoubleVector source)
Creates a copy of a given DoubleVector with the same type as the original.

Parameters:
source - The Vector to copy.
Returns:
A copy of source with the same type.

copyOf

public static Vector copyOf(Vector source)
Creates a copy of a given Vector.

Parameters:

Returns:
A copy of source with the same type.

instanceOf

public static <T extends Vector> T instanceOf(T vector)
Creates a Vector instance of the same type and length of the provided vector.

Parameters:
vector - a vector whose type and length should be used when creating a new vector with the same properties
Returns:
a vector with the same type and length as the provided vector
